Title: Compare camera feed to a stored image using objective-c iOS
Body:
I am a beginner in iOS development and I want to create an application that will compare an image stored in the project with the camera preview feed. It must then show a rectangle around the matched image in the preview.

I developed a c++ lib that will do the comparison. I also display the preview, but I want to get the feed and convert it to bytes so I will be able to use the lib.

how can i do that?

Title: AppCompact dont work on Xperia Z2
Body:
I have question, I create application with Theme.AppCompat.NoActionBar, but on Xperia Z2 dont work application, on this phone is only background color and nothing other, but on other phone work all, when I use holo theme, it is ok, but i use Toolbar and need setSupportActionBar();

Thanks you

Title: With Bootstrap, how do I show radio inputs as buttons?
Body:
My form currently contains this code:

<link href="https://maxcdn.bootstrapcdn.com/bootstrap/3.3.6/css/bootstrap.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<label for="opt-0"><input type="radio" name="opt" id="opt-0" checked>Option 0</label>
<label for="opt-1"><input type="radio" name="opt" id="opt-1">Option 1</label>
<label for="opt-2"><input type="radio" name="opt" id="opt-2">Option 2</label>

Instead of showing the radio buttons as radio buttons, I'd like to make them look like regular buttons, like this:

<link href="https://maxcdn.bootstrapcdn.com/bootstrap/3.3.6/css/bootstrap.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<button class="btn btn-primary">Option 0</button>
<button class="btn btn-default">Option 1</button>
<button class="btn btn-default">Option 2</button>

I have radios and I want to make them look like toggleable buttons. How am I supposed to do that with Bootstrap?

Title: Stop until in ruby when condition is met
Body:
I have a test that I want to make sure can't be stuck in an infinite loop, what I would like to try is to make the loop run only a certain amount of times, but I'm not sure how to limit the code to only run a certain amount of time. I think I need to use a counter but I'm not sure how to implement it, here is the code for the test.

    When /^I click the Settings link$/ do
      footer = @browser.div(:id, 'iwinbottombar')
      footer.wait_until_present
      unless footer.html.include?('Settings')
        throw Exception.new("Expected to see the settings button but it was not there")
      end
      until
      @browser.div(:id , 'dialogcontainer').div(:class , 'settings_browsebutton button clickable').present? do
      footer.a(:class , 'button_settings').when_present.click
      end
    end

Title: sendmail.php - send email to variable AND email address
Body:
I have a PHP sendmail script that sends to an email address from user input:

$to = $_POST['email'];

How do I add an actual email address to go alongside that - for example:

$to = $_POST['email', 'foo@bar.com'];

Thanks

Title: What would happen if Create a object in non-static method of class in java?
Angular2 conditional routing
Body:
This might be a basic question, but in Angular2 is there any way to do conditional routing ? Or, would someone do that outside the router ?

I know ui-router had some ability to do this, but I haven't seen anything similar in Angular2s router

Title: Beautiful Soup if Class "Contains" or Regex?
Body:
If my class names are constantly different say for example:

listing-col-line-3-11 dpt 41
listing-col-block-1-22 dpt 41
listing-col-line-4-13 CWK 12

Normally I could do:

for EachPart in soup.find_all("div", {"class" : "ClassNamesHere"}):
            print EachPart.get_text()

There are way too many class names to work with here so a bunch of these are out.

I know Python doesn't have a ".contains" I would normally use but it does have an "in". Though I haven't been able to work out a way to incorporate that.

I'm hoping there's a way to do this with regex. Though again my Python syntax is really letting me down I've been trying variations on:

regex = re.compile('.*listing-col-.*')
    for EachPart in soup.find_all(regex):

But that doesn't seem to be doing the trick.

Body: Do you need license for publishing android apps? (Not on play store but the direct download way)
